ps3.6:0.3_0: The discussion of the Monastic Code.
ps3.6:1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these three kinds of demonstration.
ps3.6:1.3_0: The demonstration of psychic power, the demonstration of revealing, and the demonstration of instruction.
ps3.6:10.1_0: the knowledge, and they find it.
ps3.6:10.3_0: Those who have all known for themselves,
ps3.6:10.4_0: The demonstration of revealing is finished.
ps3.6:10.5_0: “They should be developed and cultivated in this way. That’s how to develop and cultivate the principled speech in this way.”
ps3.6:11.3_0: Their ethical conduct is purified from all these things.
ps3.6:11.4_0: The demonstration of revealing is finished.
ps3.6:11.5_0: “And this should be developed and cultivated in this way. That’s how joy should be cultivated and developed.”
ps3.6:12.1_0: the first absorption, its outcome and result.
ps3.6:12.2_0: The hindrance of the hindrance of hindrances.
ps3.6:12.3_0: And all of the mendicants who had absorptions and unsullied intentions.
ps3.6:12.4_0: The demonstration of revealing is finished.
ps3.6:12.5_0: “And this is how the first absorption should be developed and cultivated in this way. You should develop mindfulness and situational awareness.”
ps3.6:13.2_0: it should be relinquished to a pretext—
ps3.6:13.3_0: They have all unconfused intentions about perfection and did so.
ps3.6:13.4_0: The demonstration of revealing is finished.
ps3.6:13.5_0: ‘But be attended on by perfection, and should be developed like this:
ps3.6:14.10_0: it should be relinquished to a pretext—
ps3.6:14.11_0: And the demonstration of psychic power that this is called “Stempered”.
ps3.6:14.12_0: The account of the wonders at Pāṭaliputta is finished.
ps3.6:14.2_0: The demonstration of sensual desire also came to be relinquished.
ps3.6:14.3_0: But the demonstration of psychic power that is called the demonstration of psychic power.
ps3.6:14.5_0: The demonstration of ill will is finished.
ps3.6:14.6_0: But the demonstration of psychic power that is called the demonstration of psychic power.
ps3.6:2.1_0: Then—immoral demonstration of psychic power, the previous discourse is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods:
ps3.6:2.2_0: It’s when someone wields the many kinds of psychic power:
ps3.6:2.4_0: They develop the awakening factor of development ...
ps3.6:2.5_0: as far as the Brahmā realm.
ps3.6:2.6_0: This is called the demonstration of psychic power.
ps3.6:3.10_0: they’re much and don’t say that even though it fully admitted, and they still have.
ps3.6:3.11_0: In another case, someone comprehends the mind of a person who has attained the immersion that’s free of placing the mind and keeping it connected. They understand:
ps3.6:3.12_0: ‘Judging by the way this person’s intentions are directed, immediately after this mind state they’ll think this thought.’
ps3.6:3.13_0: they’re much and don’t say that even though it fully admitted, and they still have.
ps3.6:3.14_0: This is called the demonstration of revealing.
ps3.6:3.1_0: And tossed aside like this, so too, are—imagining to apply himself to cloak, bones, and ignorance—
ps3.6:3.2_0: It’s when someone reveals by means of a sign,
ps3.6:3.4_0: they’re much and don’t say that even though it fully admitted, and they still have.
ps3.6:3.5_0: or after hearing it from humans, non-humans, or deities,
ps3.6:3.7_0: they’re much and don’t say that even though it fully admitted, and they still have.
ps3.6:3.8_0: In another case, someone reveals by hearing the sound of thought spreading as someone thinks and considers:
ps3.6:4.1_0: What can be done by a unanimous assembly and instructing the demonstration of instruction?
ps3.6:4.2_0: It’s when someone instructs others like this:
ps3.6:4.4_0: pay attention like this, not like this;
ps3.6:4.5_0: abandon this; having attained this, abide in it.’
ps3.6:4.6_0: This is called a demonstration of instruction.
ps3.6:4.7_0: These are the three kinds of demonstration.”
ps3.6:5.2_0: The demonstration of sensual desire also came to be relinquished.
ps3.6:5.3_0: Those who have experiential confidence in the renunciation have unsullied intentions.
ps3.6:5.4_0: The demonstration of revealing is finished.
ps3.6:5.5_0: “And when there are cultivated in this way, should be developed and cultivated in this way, depending on and grounded on principle.”
ps3.6:6.2_0: The demonstration of ill will is finished.
ps3.6:6.3_0: And those who have ill will and malevolence regarding good will,
ps3.6:6.4_0: The demonstration of revealing is finished.
ps3.6:6.5_0: ‘This good will be cultivated in this way. You should develop mindfulness and cultivate the kind of good will, and develop it in this way.’”
ps3.6:7.3_0: And as they meditate with their minds purified, their intentions are unsullied intentions.
ps3.6:7.4_0: The demonstration of revealing is finished.
ps3.6:7.5_0: “And when the perception of light has been cultivated in this way, should be developed and cultivated in this way. That’s how to develop mindfulness and situational awareness.”
ps3.6:8.1_0: having fallen into trouble and difficulty.
ps3.6:8.2_0: The demonstration of restlessness is finished.
ps3.6:8.3_0: And all of those who have at all.”
ps3.6:8.4_0: The demonstration of revealing is finished.
ps3.6:8.5_0: ‘They should be developed and cultivated in this way, be should be developed and cultivated in this way. This should be attended on by mindfulness.”
ps3.6:9.1_0: Having understood the teaching and training that they penetrate it.
ps3.6:9.3_0: And those who have practiced in line with the teaching are purified by that, their minds have unsullied intentions.
ps3.6:9.4_0: The demonstration of revealing is finished.
ps3.6:9.5_0: “Someone who has memorized the teaching should be cultivated in this way, and should be developed in that way.”
